results.title: Challenge of flight
results.creator_credit: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Shows the tough and rigorous pilot training courses conducted by the Royal Australian Air Force at Point Cook in Victoria and at Pearce in Western Australia. Only fifty per cent of trainees pass the course.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: Diggers
results.creator_credit: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Despite the advanced state of military technology it is still the “Digger” who determines the success or otherwise of the Australian Army. It is the infantry soldier who must find the enemy, capture his territory and fight him at close quarters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: The Shape of ships to come
results.creator_credit: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
A look at the guided missile frigate HMAS Adelaide, a new breed of ship in the destroyer class. It is the first Australian warship to be fitted with gas turbine engines, to have helicopter carrying capabilities and to be equipped with the over horizon missile ‘Harpoon’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.

results.title: Light the deep
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Defence scientists, using special laser technology, have developed a sophisticated device which will benefit the hydrographers of the world. It is used by the Royal Australian Navy, responsible for the production of all Australian navigational charts.

results.title: A Fighting chance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Max Inglis, a Norfolk Island resident, owes his life to a recent RAAF aeromedical evacuation operation, but he is only one of thousands of Australians whose lives have been saved by this unique service.

results.title: Coastwatch
results.creator_credit: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Australia has the largest accessible coastline in the world. The first line of defence is the coastwatch. The Fremantle class a fast all weather vessel has been introduced as the new type of patrol boat that will provide security for the nation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Scheldrup, Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: Rescue 036
results.creator_credit: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
The Army Aviation Centre at Oakey, Queensland, has more helicopter movements per year than any other airfield in Australia. Therefore the potential of aircraft accidents is great. The Army Aviation Corps have devised a crash rescue system designed to provide medical assistance to crash victims in the shortest possible time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: Malaria: the recurring enemy
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Department of Defence Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Malaria has again become a major world health problem. Strains of malaria parasite have been resistant to drugs and species of anopheles mosquito have developed a tolerance for insecticides. Although research is being carried out aimed at defeating the disease, it still poses a threat to some areas of Australia. Features some black and white sequences. Commentary by Roger Newcombe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent Donovan and Department of Defence Public Relations

results.title: Sappers K9: the dogs of war
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Concealed explosives have maimed and killed Australians in military conflict and society because they do not necessarily incorporate metallic components and are undetectable by conventional machines. The use of a special breed of German Shepherd dog by the Royal Australian Engineers promises greater security.

results.title: Limiting the goblin
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
The unidentified submarine intruder known as “the Goblin” is no longer free to trespass at will in Australia’s waters. The “Barra” sonobuoy, the world’s most advanced submarine detection device is now in operation with the Royal Australian Air Force.
